element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm performs texture analysis on an image and calculates the Angular Second Moment
This parameter is calculated from the Grey-level coocurrence matrix (GLCM), following the ideas defined by Haralick in his seminal article
Robert M Haralick, K Shanmugam, Its'hak Dinstein (1973). "Textural Features for Image Classification". IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics SMC-3 (6): 610–621.
Detailed descriptions of both the GLCM and ASM can be found at http://www.fp.ucalgary.ca/mhallbey/tutorial.htm

element.name: WINDOW_RADIUS
element.text: The radius of the analysis window. Texture is calculated for each pixel taking into account pixels in an analysis window of the given radius centered on it.The radius of the analysis window. element.name: SHIFTX
element.text: The X distance between two pixels in the analysis window. The GLCM is created using this shift distance.

element.name: SHIFTY
element.text: The Y distance between two pixels in the analysis window. The GLCM is created using this shift distance.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The resulting layer with contrast values
